docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The Terraform Plugin can be used to create AWS cloud infrastructures like EC2 instances.

docs.title: Compatibility
docs.text:
The plug-in is compatible with:

  • UrbanCode Deploy version 7.0.0 or later
  • IBM Java 8 or 11

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: No special steps are required for installation. See Installing plug-ins in UrbanCode products.

docs.title: Version 0.1
docs.text: • Initial release of the new Tearraform Plugin.

docs.title: Process steps in the Terraform-IAAC plug-in
Run Terraform Command (AWS)
docs.text:
Use this step to execute rexx program

Name Type Description Required Terraform File Path String Full path of the .tf file that contains all configurations needed for a resource creation for any cloud service provider. Yes Terraform Installation Path String Full path of the terraform installation. Ex: /usr/local/bin/. Yes AWS Role String AWS Role to assume No

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: You can use the Terraform plug-in to execute any terraform script related to the AWS cloud services.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
You can use this plug-in to create an EC2 instance.

We can have the contents of the EC2.tf file as below

provider "aws" {
region = "us-east-1"
}

resource "aws_instance" "example" {
ami           = "ami-01816d07b1128cd2d"
instance_type = "t2.micro"
subnet_id     = "subnet-0df5b39681b4b5ec9"

tags = {
Name = "Plugins-4458-img8"
}

associate_public_ip_address = false
security_groups = ["sg-013c621e45933e3c2"]
}
